newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentina's Acindar to buy back $150 mln in debt.
newsitem.headline: Argentina's Acindar to buy back $150 mln in debt.

text.p: Argentine steelmaker Acindar said Friday it will use a four-part financing plan to buy back a $150 million bond issued in 1993, and seek permission to issue a longer term bond for the same amount.
In a statement to the Buenos Aires Stock Exchange, Acindar said it will raise the funds to buy back debt through the following channels:
* It will issue $30 million in convertible negotiable bonds.
* It will use $24 million from a line of credit for exports to southeast Asia.
* It announced an accord under which Chase Securities Inc will buy and redistribute $65 million in bonds.
* It will get a stand-by bridge loan by Credit Suisse for $25 million.
"Simultaneously, the company is seeking authorization for a long-term bond issue of up to $150 million to be placed in Argentina and the United States," Acindar said.
